Posted By: MrShinyObject (7/10/2013 6:33:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You've gotta love how that one extra point of power tells you exactly what kind of a deck this belongs in.  
  
On a side note, the sheer fact that this kid isn't legendary ([Talrand, Sky Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Talrand, Sky Summoner)) means that I'll feel a lot better about dropping four of him into any deck I make. The idea of having multiple Young Pyromancers out at the same time is pretty sweet.  
  
Between being a 2-drop and only requiring one red mana, it's pretty clear that this kid is going to see a lot of action in a lot of different decks. Exciting stuff.
posts.html:
You've gotta love how that one extra point of power tells you exactly what kind of a deck this belongs in.

On a side note, the sheer fact that this kid isn't legendary (Talrand, Sky Summoner) means that I'll feel a lot better about dropping four of him into any deck I make. The idea of having multiple Young Pyromancers out at the same time is pretty sweet.

Between being a 2-drop and only requiring one red mana, it's pretty clear that this kid is going to see a lot of action in a lot of different decks. Exciting stuff.

posts.post_content: I think this card is great. Get a couple out, start casting [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock) and [Pillar of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillar of Flame), making a bunch of creatures. [Battle Hymn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Battle Hymn) into a [Massive Raid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Massive Raid) (with [Faithless Looting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faithless Looting) if necessary), followed by [Seismic Stomp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seismic Stomp), and it's game.

posts.post_content:
Great card if it stays on the board... I can see this landing a solid place in some constructed decks. A mini [Talrand, Sky Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Talrand, Sky Summoner) without Legendary so you can run 4 of them, get them out sooner, and use their ability as soon as it hits the table.  
  
The artwork is nice, the flavour text fits. Simple, well designed card and very playable. The kind I like to see.
posts.html:
Great card if it stays on the board... I can see this landing a solid place in some constructed decks. A mini Talrand, Sky Summoner without Legendary so you can run 4 of them, get them out sooner, and use their ability as soon as it hits the table.

The artwork is nice, the flavour text fits. Simple, well designed card and very playable. The kind I like to see.

posts.post_content:
@ Continue:   
  
  
Thalia's good and all....but she's more like [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary) or [Gaddock Teeg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaddock Teeg) good. The OTHERS you named, are closer to [MASTICORE](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=MASTICORE) good.  
  
See [Deep Analysis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deep Analysis) (not the Nicol Bolas one).  
  
Masticore-Good means ''the subject appears to be broken". Wizards is deliberately in a mindset to try to NOT make such cards. And it's really hard to accidentally make ACTUALLY Broken cards for Red. We simply won't see this cycle completed. We simply won't.   
  
STONEFORGE MYSTIC is your White Lady. The cards of the Power Pikers have to all be cards you would say should be \*considered\* for BANNING IN LEGACY because of how Broken they are. Not necessarily ACTUALLY banned, but that the conversation is a fair one to have. Thalia just does not qualify, and Stoneforge Mystic just does.   
  
[Goblin Recruiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Recruiter) is the closest Red will ever have to anything like the POWER PIKERS. THAT'S how good y... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
(while still standard)  
T1: Steamvents/Island --> Delver of Secrets  
T2: Sulfur Falls/Mountain ---> Young Pyromancer (possibly flipped Delver)  
T3: Any land ---> Gutter Snipe  
T4 --- T8: Izzet Control, and they'll die eventually.  
(downpours, flames of the firebrand, your choice of 2 cost counterspells, shocks, turn//burn, etc etc)  
  
I can't imagine a better mana curve than those 3 creatures.  
gunna go wreck face tonight at fnm.
